answers.text: obligations established by agreement (express or implied) between private parties

qas.question: What kinds of agreements do contract law cover?

plausible_answers.text: obligations established by agreement (express or implied) between private parties

qas.question: What does contract law not cover?

plausible_answers.text: transactions involving the sale of goods

qas.question: What did the Restatement (Second) of Contracts standardize?
The Uniform Commercial Code limited the diversity of what?
What types of agreements does the Restatement of Contracts cover?

context: Contract law covers <a0_0><b3_0>obligations established by agreement (<a2_0><b7_0>express or implied<b7_0/><a2_0/>) between private parties<b3_0/><a0_0/>. Generally, contract law in <b5_0>transactions involving the sale of goods<b5_0/> has become highly standardized nationwide as a result of the widespread adoption of the <a1_0><b4_0>Uniform Commercial Code<b4_0/><a1_0/>. However, there is still significant diversity in the interpretation of <b6_0>other kinds of contracts<b6_0/>, depending upon the extent to which a given state has codified its common law of contracts or adopted portions of the Restatement (Second) of Contracts.
